title: Why don't people in low elo peel for their adc?
body: I've rarely ever been peeled for ever, tank running straight towards me? good luck me i ain't getting no fucking help.  Then half the time they have the audacity to flame me for it. The one time i did get a team that peeled for me, that feeling gave me an erection lasting over 4 hours.But that was 1 time in over a 100 games, and peeling for your god damn carry is what will make or break the fight. You don't even need cc just fall on top of me and the guy locking me down so i can reposition jesus.

replies.body:
Because the ADC usually runs into melee range at that elo.

How do you peel that?
Play thresh and give them a way out when they realized they screwed up; or play tahm and force them to leave their foolish fight, lol.
they need to click the lantern first. best off just playing tahm and forcing them to leave when they fucked up.
Which is why I play Tahm. It's like being a bartender and telling someone they've had too much to drink.
And then they just eject straight into the enemy team after 2 seconds.
i still haven't figured out how to eject myself from tahm.
You click on the ground after a delay. So please don't be one of those that randomly click themselves into their deaths and then blame the Tahm.
Agreed, this is so frustratingly annoying.

The amount of times I've had adc's flash over my lanterns........


If you eat them with Tahm 9/10 times you get hardcore flamed lol
Same thing with braum, try to shield an ally, only for them to flash away from you and get killed. Things like these are probably a reason why some supports went to aggressive mages, lol.
Lol yeah, the whole "if I kill them before they kill you" kinda thing. I must like torture though lol #tanksupport4lyfe
Same here, though if you can find a skilled buddy, the kalista & tahm combo can be quite the irritating game changer.

I mean, it's obviously everyone else's fault for not following the Vayne who Flash/Ult/Tumble'd into the 1v5 to manage two autos off before being deleted.
Get the the program!

Think I have a conversation about this like once a month. People ask me what I'd climb with if I started from scratch. I say I'd go support. They mention that supporting isn't worthwhile because marksmen don't farm well enough or position well enough to be worth protecting.  I disagree.  

It's the lack of faith in teammates. Hard to get over that from both sides of the coin.
As a support player, the lack of trust feels big. When i am in that case, i just buy ZZ'roth. Sometimes even Banner.
You are a support who buys both ZZ'rot and Banner without me begging for 10 minutes? I love you already!

Yup. I cruised controlled from mid silver to (currently) plat 2 as pretty much exclusively solo support janna. Lots of people are bad at support, so if you're not and actually *do* peel, it makes a world of difference.

I might lean towards adc for bronze though, and position yourself under the assumption you won't have peel. Enough random enemy mistakes to punish that you don't need to be particularly aggressive to get fed.

Wow what an accomplishment! You stopped pushing on the door that says "pull".
Now you wanna get into diamond 5? Try stepping into the door.

# #koreanadvices

I remember getting out of bronze by playing adc even tough im horrible at it . I cant kite, trade right and i cant attackmove but i could farm. I just spend the first 20 min of the game towerhugging and farming up while every one else was running around aimlessly half of the time so when grouping up and teamfighting started i was an item ahead of the rest and could just stay all the way in the back and melt whoever got close and actually take objectives instead of backing like all the adcs did back there in season 3. After that i took support to get through silver. Now im stuck in gold 4 for 2 seasons. Earlier this season it looked like i could get out with top and jugnle but i fell back after midseason. I have doued with low plats a lot and i can hold my own there but i just cant figure out what i need to do to concistantly carry my team to get there.

What you need to do is find a role you are good at and consistently play it till you get really good at it look at your mistakes after games watch over yourself and find ways you can get better. Thats probably why the koreans are so much better at the game then us tbh they have more dedication its just sorta in their culture.

No, That is not how you do it yougo full mobility boots{{item:3117}}  and play {{champion:17}} dont forget the  This is important {{item:3070}} 


how I got to b3 OPOP meta

Last season I climbed from B5 to G5 playing support, and S5 to G5 this season, and I've gotta say that I agree with you. If you have the patience and make sure you help where you need to, then it's not so bad

So, when are you guys going to take care about people that don't autoattack/press buttons in temfights, recall in the middle of teamfights full hp, recall in front of turrets/inhibitors after an ace and with a huge wave stacked in our favor, refuse to push afte lv7, refuse to come to baron after a won teamfight, refuse to close the game making it last 15-25 more minutes, get dumpstered for the whole game and when somebody in their team manages to get somehow them back in business they keep throwing suiciding 1v5 one at time instead of just closing the game/listening to orders and then mock you in chat or hit you with the "IT'S JUST A GAEM BRAH XD"?

Because one thing i noticed, the same guys that goes "it is only game, why do you heff to be mad?", "i'm just having fun", refuse to take objectives, cockblock you not following you in plays even if it's extremely mechanically simple and so on, are the same that start foaming from their mouths and punching themselves in the head when the game starts becoming actually unwinnable  because of them and start babbling in chat about "reprots" and "noobs" and whatever their limited vocabulary suggests them.

Because that's one of the main reasons i don't play ranked and place myself where it's my right to be, because i don't want to deal with x5 times the extra games i need to play because somebody decided to make me lose because their mother probably slapped them that day and told them they can't have ice cream after dinner.

Also, do you guys realize that in this game not knowing the game, even in its simplest aspects not only it's widely accepted but it's considered the norm?

One last thing, with your new tips during the loading screen i was really hoping for and expecting the "Did you know: after lv7, you must push the waves past mid point between the 2 turrets standing, otherwise you lose pressure and your team and yourself will pay the consequences".
I honestly don't care about knowing that on the opposite side of the planet there is a sushi restaurant that offered discounts based on league's rank, because if that restaurant based their discounts on actual skill rather than a meaningless badge given by an abusable and broken system i should have a lifetime supply of free high quality sushi, i would much rather have my teammates not be useless at best and not walk afk for 40 minutes, but of course we can't add that tooltip, otherwise everybody would be plat by now wouldn't it? (daily reminder that diamond 2 is the level 0 in terms of skills and knowledge in league of legends, anything else is just irrelevant)

Thank you. I feel like I have to scream it out sometimes that League is a team game, and that playing a match isn't suppose to be a 1v9. If there is one major issue I find in the league community, its that "carry syndrome" is rampant, and endorsed by a large portion of the leaguetubers you see out there. People keep getting told that to win they have to "Get off their asses and carry their teams", and it makes them inherently mistrustful of their teammates sometimes even before the match begins. Players need to learn communication, composition, and win conditions, but so many are just convinced that to climb, they just need to be "better" than everyone else, and get mad when the harsh reality of League's team nature hits them in the face.

I also do not like the "carry syndrome", for me is not even funny the game played this way. But on the other hand, if you are the only one who knows communication, composition, and win conditions; how do you win? What i mean is that if your team doesnt know how to play and throw what are you suposed to do? If they don't try to do baron when we win a fight, if someone keeps dying for going alone with no vision (turning the game a 4vs5), what do you do? I strated to think than the only option is to be able to make the job of the player that is stupid, to be worth more than 1 player. And probably its true: I am main adc and the only champ i play archiving a 60% winrate or higher is vayne. It means that i have to play an hipercarry who can fight more than 1 enemy at once at late game if you are decent at it, that can do objectives alone because you dont care if an enemy comes because you know you will be able to kill him alone (not the opposite like it happens with regular adc). Vayne is not team reliant in teamfights also because of evasion power. The only weak point is when you team fails so hard in early or when the enemy botlane (ex: cait and sona) doesnt let you farm and your support is not able to do anything at it and the jungler doesnt care, what is more, other lanes are feedeing so you dont even have the chance to recover during midgame.

Thats my ranked experience, lats season i got gold just playing vayne (sometimes jinx or lucian), now i tried to play more adc and at first i thought i was bad and i keeped practising in normals, i became good at them but when i started again with rankeds i losed too many games if i didnt play with friends or with vayne. The worst is the feeling i get of depending on my teammates and not getting listened or even noticed, is the feeling of not having any presence no matter my skill and knowledge.

Faith will not make then better in the same way rage does not.
I will not give up my farm and carrying potential to someone that know less than me about kiting, preserving advantage and lead objectives.
Just for records i am a support main since season 3.

i would play master yi any day in low elo and be happy ^^
On the other hand,when you try to save them and have faith in them in solo Q,you almost always die for it.This is why in LCS people peel for each other,they know how good everyone is.

I feel like I am a support main. But in past few weeks have been playing more top and mid. 

i've always said not everyone is supportable. And my recent quest back into the support role today proved it when i had the unfortunate luxury of having to support a ALL MELEE team with the onlyt AP being the  AP Shaco in the ADC role. Oh what fun!...........not

Personally I think that is just a symptom of the real problem.

The real problem is the tutorial mission that teaches peeling...*namely that it doesn't exist.*

Why are new players expected to magically know what peeling even is? Where in the game is this mechanic/tactic *ever* described, let alone actually shown, demonstrated, and explained?

I've been playing since the end of Season 1 - back in the days of old when Marksmen were played solo mid. I remember having to try to explain to my teammates that Ashe didn't have to go mid, that pros and high level players were taking AD Carries bot lane. The idea of having one player dedicated to protecting the carry *literally did not exist in low level play back then*. Hell, climbing to Level 30 I was unable to practice jungling and was constantly flamed whenever I tried because the game never explained that you can start in the jungle (and because no one had any concept of playing a 2v1 lane if the enemy didn't bother jungling). Support and Jungle basically require immense game knowledge *just to exist as player roles* because there is nothing in the game that explains them. 

**Of course we have no faith in our teammates' abilities: The only way to succeed is to have mechanics/tactics/knowledge that does not exist anywhere in-game and we have no way of knowing if they actually have them or not. *Most of the people playing this game aren't even invested enough to use the Boards, Reddit, or third party sites that might explain these concepts - tons of people that play don't even read the patch notes.     ***

Not too long ago I had a Ranked game where our Bot lane carry was a Lucian main...and the other team picked Lucian first. He ended up playing Sivir, who was one of the only other Marksmen he had, and he admitted that he basically never played her before. Our support couldn't do anything to save him. *When things like this happen regularly at lower levels of play, how are we supposed to trust our teammates???*

***We need a real tutorial system and at least Mastery Level 2 before a champ can be played in Ranked. Maybe then we can expect everyone to have some kind of baseline skill we can trust.***

Important Phrase: Low Elo.


i don't peel for my adc sometimes because they don't position in a place that i can peel for them. like stand in the frontline. facecheck a bush. or stand so far back after an initiation for no reason whatsoever that they just get jumped on by a zed.

 adcs are supposed to stand in a safe area that their frontline creates. not move all over the fucking place and confuse the shit out of the team. which is easier? . the 1 should follow the 4 not the other way around

i try my best to make sure im behind the tanky dudes when i feel a fight is gonna break out. Though i just get run down if somebody dives after me while the rest tunnel vision on the enemy tank FeelsBadMan

True that happened to me recently as jinx i would go out fight the enemies sit with my tanks then bam someoen from the enemy team gets on me and everyone is too busy fightint the laner i destroyed or chasing a feeder to actually help now i dont blame them i dont konw how many times some feeding top lane or mid lane gave me crap when i supported since i would be "1-3" then they forget the 15 or ill be "1-6" and they would forget im the only tank on the team and they all chose sqiushies who need peel non stop so i would be 1-6 with 15 assits but i have to tank non stop damage and just get destroyed {{champion:3}}
the only thing you can peel in bronze is ur own hair

WW player from recent game I played: "ADC is sooooo easy. Just play safe lol"

So most likely, it's because of players mentalities. The "gotta carry" attitude means that they have to be the ones dealing damage. Not you.
"But muh kills"

Firstly, I fulfil what you claim low elo people like mahself don't do, it's why I play the tanks I play (naut, sej, zac, sion and tahm kench)

But in regards to your question. Many people have mentioned a lack of faith and that is a big part of it. Many low elo players (bronze to mid gold IMO) share the mindset of a "solo-carry" , cloud out their team mates as they view them as a hindrance and  live in a "god complex" (they're perfect, always right and belong in diamond). They view themselves as the teams only hope, hogging cs and kill gold from other lanes in a sad effort to fulfil their fantasy of "solo-carrying" their way out of bronze/silver. 
When everything falls to crap, say they start dropping off while the enemy scales or their team mates are too far behind due to gold deprivation, they generally don't go "oops I hogged all the gold MB". 
More so "OMFG YOU'RE ALL SO SHIT! REPORTED COS YOU'RE TO HEAVY TO CARRY SCRUBS". That begins an endless cycle of; get completely up yourself, hog all the gold as a knight in shining armour, get pissed off when your team can't play as if they're hyper fed and then blame and loose faith in them because they haven't lived up to your expectations.

However there have been cases where I have wondered "wtf is this guy doing?" As I've popped every spell, locket and randuins but instead of running away or using me to block projectiles..... they charge head first into a lethal front line thinking they can 1v1 while my stuff's on cool down. Or you really do get the occasional poor soul who really does have no idea (perhaps was forced into a role their bad at last season) and cops allot of flack from your hyper fed team mates.
Do I change peel priority if this happens? yep. What if both hyper carries do it? Hit and hope.
I think you answered it by saying it's low elo. They probably don't know or understand.
i don't understand how they don't understand, why on earth wouldn't you protect your main source of damage?
Low elo means low skill. People aren't born into this world knowing everything.
It depends on who youre playing with really. If i'm playing nautilus top/jg. you can definitely expect me to both peel for whoever is carrying and deal moderate damage.

From the perspective of a Top lane player, peeling for your ADC in low tiers is actually a gamble. Let's say everyone plays perfectly, now the game comes down to which team has the more beefy front line or which AD outputs the most damage. While you're giving your AD more room to breathe and carry, you are also allowing the enemies AD the same exact thing as they aren't being pressured since the team is just peeling for their DPS. Unless it's late game and your AD is doing extremely well, there's absolutely no reason to ever put yourself into that scenario where the fights come down to two players while you sit around being a punching bag for them.

IMO, the reason no one peels in low tiers is because it's simply not worth it. 90% of the time, it's far easier to carry games yourself with good mechanics and decision making.

"im an independent supprot im no ones bitch XDXDXDXDXDXDXD"

Most people play with the mentality of "don't trust your teammates" so they don't even peel for anyone, but in reality all they need to do is know when and who to peel. It's not just "peel the ADC", but moreso "peel whoever is fed", usually including ADCs.

THIS

THIS

THIS 

100 TIMES THIS

AS SOMEONE WHO HAS BEEN PLAYING ADC A LOT MY TEAM ALMOST NEVER PEELS FOR ME.

I'll stay in the back of my team during fights, I'll use my ult defensively if someone is on top of me (I'm a level 7 {{champion:498}}), I'll ping I need assistance

My entire team runs up ahead to chase people and leaves me to die, and then questions why I don't do anything..



In higher elos people actually run "protect the adc" teamcomps because your adc DOES A LOT OF CONSISTENT DAMAGE. It's not like a mage who bursts, your adc is half or even all of your damage on a team. Your adc is the one melting tanks. If you have no adc you will not have a big chunk of damage, why are you letting them die?


You should want to protect your adc at all costs ESPECIALLY if they are fed. Do NOT RUN DOWN LANE OR CHASE PEOPLE AND LEAVE THE ADC ALONE IN FIGHTS.


I can't tell you how many games I've lost where I won my lane, gotten fed, and we constantly lose teamfights because my team refuses to peel for me and protect me so that I can do what I need to do. All I need is maybe 1 person to just make sure I'm protected so that I can dish out my damage. 


That's not me being like a stubborn privileged brat or anything whining that I want protection. That's me saying in order for us to win fights, I need to do damage, and I can't do that if the enemy is on top of me. 


If you want to win fights then you need to protect your damage dealers.

> [{quoted}](name=thacrazytaco,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oIeItqes,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-09-11T04:28:18.398+0000)
>
> tank running straight towards me? good luck me i ain&#039;t getting no fucking help.

Well stuff like this is a catch 22.......i mean think about it. Lets say im supporting you with Leona or Malphite. I am the tank, I am expected to initiate the fights. My target it supposed to be the other teams adc or another squish. If i spam my kit going in on them.......the rest of the team should be following up. Now abilities are on cooldown....what am i going to use to peel for you?

Now change it up. Lets say I go straight bodygaurd mode and now im just saving abilities to use on whoever comes for you...whos going to initiate?

> [{quoted}](name=thacrazytaco,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oIeItqes,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-09-11T04:28:18.398+0000)

As far as that....that might of been the viagra lol.....you know in the commercial it says if it last longer than 4 hours to seek a doctor lol.

You're essentially asking the same question as to why failing students get bad grades or fat students are bad at sports. In most cases if they weren't failing they wouldn't get bad grades, and if they were good at sports they wouldn't be chubby.

Same thing for League - if they understood game mechanics and the importance of peeling for their ADC, they wouldn't be in a low ELO.
I started maining assassins when I found out most of the ad's in low ELO don't move in between aa's. I climbed to G1
I still have no idea why Braum supports wait until I have 15% of my health left or save their ultimate for no apparent reason.

I've peeled for many dying ADCs who think that me busting every CC spell I own is the green light to re-engage when they have a sliver of HP remaining. They die. Why do I bother peeling if the ADC isn't smart enough to leave a fight when they're about to die?

If it's below Plat, or even low Plat, don't expect for them to peel for you ever. I mean, I peel hardcore for my ADCs as a support... unless they're a prick, then they get no peel and no heal. 
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
